text:
Congratulations are in order: Camille Grammer is married!

The "Real Housewives of Beverly Hills" staple said "I do" to boyfriend David C. Meyer during a Hawaiian getaway on Saturday, a year after announcing their engagement.

People shared the couple's beachfront wedding portrait. Grammer wore a sweeping white gown with floral cutouts and flowers in her hair, which she left long and loose. Meyer wore a tuxedo with a white jacket and black trousers.

The reality star's representative, Howard Bragman, confirmed the nuptials to USA TODAY.

Need a news break? Check out the all new PLAY hub with puzzles, games and more!

Grammer, 50, was previously married to the "Frasier" star Kelsey Grammer from 1997 until their bitter divorce in 2011. They share two children together – daughter Mason, 16, and son Jude, 14 – who were both at hand during their mother's ceremony, according to People.

Mason was a bridesmaid and Jude walked his mom down the aisle.

Related: Karlie Kloss weds Joshua Kushner, younger brother of Jared Kushner, after short engagement

Fellow "Housewives" Kyle Richards, Teddi Mellencamp, Dorit Kemsley and Lisa Rinna attended the nuptials, with Richards and Kemsley sharing images from the festivities to Instagram. Richards also served as a bridesmaid, complete with a flower crown.

Related: Newlywed Gwyneth Paltrow gushes over married life with Brad Falchuk: 'I feel so lucky'

Days before her ceremony, Grammer showed off her bikini bod: "Morning training Hawaiian style. Just finished a wonderful 2.8 mile paddle and swim. Took a few underwater pics of an two eagle rays swimming beneath us."

Related: 6 major moments from Princess Eugenie and Jack Brooksbanks' royal wedding day
title: 'The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills' star Camille Grammer marries David C. Meyer
